item.description:
Here's an opportunity to get further information and training on barefoot running from one of the earliest proponents of barefoot running. Ken Bob Saxton will be giving a free workshop from 10 am to 12:30 pm on Saturday, June 15th, at Kennedy Park, located at the corner of Memorial Drive and JFK St/N. Harvard St. We'll be meeting in the park very near the corner.

Here's all the info you want to know about Barefoot Ken Bob from his website: RunningBarefoot.org

 

Focus of Workshop:

Focus in Barefoot Ken Bob’s Running Barefoot Workshops is typically on walking/running technique, not on senselessly pounding out miles. Distance comes AFTER mastering gentle technique (no pounding). There is, after all, no sense in practicing bad or injurious technique. Folks can stick around afterward for a run (with or without shoes) with Barefoot Ken Bob, Cathy, and maybe Herman too.

PARKING

Please plan to come early, armed with approximately 20 quarters if you are not coming by the "T". Parking will be around the Cambridge Common on such streets as: Mass Ave, Garden Street, Appian Way, Brattle Street and other streets in the Harvard Aquare area. There will be about a 10 minute walk to the river and JFK Park. If you plan far ahead, there may be some parking spaces in THAT area. I am not familiar with that area. Again, please plan to come at least a half hour ahead of time to find a place to park and then walk to the park. If you do not have quarters, you will be in a really bad situation.

P.S. Central Parking is $9 for up to 12 hours on weekends, with a coupon from the website. It's a bit of money, but if you want to park near JFK park, and don't want to mess with quarters... 
http://boston.central...

Here's a great starting point if you want to read Ken Bob's thoughts on How to Run Barefoot
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the group of crazy barefooters!
item.name: Barefoot Ken Bob's Nor'Easter Barefoot Tour - Cambridge, MA
